alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Jones; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 1:16PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Jones, southwestern Lenoir and northeastern Duplin Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albertson, or 10 miles south of La Grange, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kornegay, Deep Run, Potters Hill, Albertson, Sarecta, Pink Hill, Sandy Bottom and Hargetts Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Newport.
